categories.title: AI Agents, Tokenomics, and Governance Models

content.text: The integration of AI agents with cryptocurrency offers several advantages: global accessibility, intuitive user experience through text and speech interfaces, progressive automation toward decentralized autonomous organizations (DAOs), and the permanent nature of AI technology that continuously improves like blockchain and the internet.

AI agents enhance LLM capabilities by providing maneuverability. When new models are released, agents can be updated with a single line of code to unlock new abilities. Open source contributors can further expand capabilities through plugins, workflows, characters, and tokenomics.

Later this year, more people will be able to self-host state-of-the-art AI models (like with Nvidia DIGITs), enabling new use cases with private data. Different models offer varying strengths and tradeoffs depending on the specific application.

Tokens help capture attention, value, and coordinate resources. For example, Eliza has grown from a solo developer project to having over 500 contributors. The tokenomics plans are in the final stages of preparation for publication, with early previews already shared.

Building tools around measuring impact, open source software contributions, and dependency graphs has the potential to scale into systems that could replace government programs. This approach, combined with fundraising capabilities, can support a more bottom-up model of governance.

In the current landscape of AI 'slopbots', there's a product opportunity for AI filters. The o3 model from OpenAI is noted as the first OpenAI model since GPT-3 that Shaw has liked. For AI agents to be successful, they need to be actively useful so they can self-market while providing value that people want.

# ElizaOS GitHub Updates

Recent activity in the ElizaOS repository includes various feature additions, bug fixes, and documentation improvements.

## New Features

- Added CREATE_POOL action in MultiversX plugin (PR #3209)
- Added TON Plugin with NFT collection, item creation, metadata change and transfer actions (PR #3211)
- Added configuration for enabling/disabling Twitter post generation (PR #3219)
- Added CoinGecko advanced functionality for various pools by network (PR #3170)
- Added Biome configuration to Solana ecosystem plugins (PR #3186)
- Added Trump character that tweets in Spanish by default (PR #3119)
- Added plugin desk exchange (PR #3096)
- Added edwin plugin to eliza (PR #3045)

## Bug Fixes

- Fixed think tag from venice (PR #3203)
- Fixed Slack download upload attachments (PR #3194)
- Fixed attribute extraction from raw text instead of normalized JSON (PR #3190)
- Updated provider-utils (PR #3189)
- Updated pnpm version during Docker build (PR #3158)
- Fixed issues after v0.1.9 release (PR #3141)
- Removed duplicated plugins (PR #3126)
- Fixed plugin-anyone (PR #3107)
- Removed duplicated dependencies (PR #3215)
- Optimized and fixed quick-intel plugin (PR #3208)

## Documentation Updates

- Renamed chat_2024-11-17.md (PR #3210)
- Updated FAQ (PR #3207)
- Fixed typos and improved consistency in community chat logs (PR #3206)
- Added weekly contributor meeting notes (PR #3204)
- Updated Twitter references to X (Twitter) (PR #3198)
- Updated GitHub Actions workflows and documentation (PR #3166)
- Fixed README_JA.md by adding unwritten text and fixing typos (PR #3153)

## Other Changes

- Standardized Security Check Identifiers across GoPlus plugin (PR #3164)

categories.title: Recent Issues in the elizaOS/eliza GitHub Repository

content.text: Several deployment and build-related issues have been reported in the elizaOS/eliza repository. Users are experiencing build errors when deploying on render.com (Issue #3212), runtime import errors in NestJs environments (Issue #3191), and Docker errors specifically on Mac M1 hardware (Issue #3239).

Multiple Twitter-related bugs have been identified, including general Twitter agent issues (Issue #3202), logging bugs (Issue #3201), and post/reply formatting errors (Issue #3245). These issues appear to be affecting the Twitter integration functionality of the platform.

Users have also reported functionality issues with the platform, including model configuration not loading from character files (Issue #3233), problems with bridging and swapping tokens in the plugin-evm (Issue #3234), and a bot repeatedly posting the same reply format message after each interaction (Issue #3252).

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several significant pull requests have been made to the elizaOS/eliza repository, focusing on blockchain integrations and system improvements:

1. Blockchain Plugin Enhancements:
   - PR #3209 adds CREATE_POOL action functionality to the MultiversX plugin
   - PR #3211 implements TON Plugin features for NFT collection, item creation, metadata changes, and transfers
   - PR #3199 adds Wallet Management capabilities to the TON Plugin
   - PR #3187 fixes ESM imports for Anchor in the @solana-developers/helpers package

2. Twitter Integration Updates:
   - PR #3237 performs cleanup on the tweet retrieval functionality
   - PR #3222 merges changes related to disabling Twitter posting
   - PR #3242 implements Twitter proxy URL functionality

3. System Maintenance:
   - PR #3216 merges changes from the develop branch to the main branch
   - PR #3220 addresses Docker and type-related issues

The elizaos/eliza repository showed significant activity over a two-day period. From February 3-4, 2025, there were 23 new pull requests with all 23 being merged, along with 6 new issues and 48 active contributors. The following day (February 4-5, 2025) saw increased activity with 26 new pull requests (though only 3 were merged), 11 new issues, and a slight increase to 50 active contributors.

The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the individual contributors, their roles, or the nature of their contributions to the elizaOS/eliza project.
